答案:
📘第1題
📌 參考答案： C

📖 詳細解釋：
P 是開花植物，屬於被子植物；Q 是黴菌，並非植物界成員，而屬於真菌界；S 是針葉樹，屬於裸子植物，雖然不開花但能結球果。
P is a flowering plant belonging to the angiosperms; Q is a mould, which actually belongs to the kingdom Fungi rather than the plant kingdom; S is a conifer, a gymnosperm that bears cones but no flowers.

R 則是蕨類植物，具有具子囊的孢子葉，是正確配對的一項。
R, on the other hand, is a fern, characterized by fronds that bear sporangia on the underside, thus the only correctly matched plant.

📖 延伸說明（可補充）:
蕨類植物屬於隱花植物，藉孢子繁殖，不產生花或種子。
Ferns are non-flowering plants (cryptogams) that reproduce by spores and not by seeds or flowers.

📌 考試提醒：
考題常混淆黴菌與藻類或隱花植物，須記得黴菌屬真菌，不含葉綠素、非植物界成員。
Examiners often test confusion between moulds, algae, and cryptogams — remember moulds are fungi, lack chlorophyll, and are not plants.

📘第2題
📌 參考答案： B

📖 詳細解釋：
Q 是黴菌，不含葉綠素，因此不能進行光合作用。
Q is a mould that lacks chlorophyll, and therefore cannot photosynthesize.

其營養方式為吸收型營養（異養），藉分泌酶分解外界有機物再吸收。
It obtains nutrients heterotrophically by secreting enzymes onto organic matter and absorbing the digested products.

其他選項皆正確：
P 會產生種子、R 以孢子繁殖、S 具球果（即裸子植物的特徵）。
The other statements are correct: P produces seeds; R reproduces by spores; S bears cones typical of gymnosperms.

📌 考試提醒：
黴菌與植物最大差異是沒有葉綠體、細胞壁成分為幾丁質（chitin），此為多選題常考重點。
The key difference between moulds and plants is that moulds have no chloroplasts and their cell walls contain chitin, a common point in multiple-choice exams.

📘第3題
📌 參考答案： A

📖 詳細解釋：
蛙、蜥蜴和鳥同屬於脊椎動物，體內均具有脊椎骨或脊柱支撐身體結構。
Frogs, lizards, and birds are all vertebrates, possessing a backbone or vertebral column that supports their body.

選項B錯在於蛙與蜥蜴是冷血動物，而鳥是恆溫動物；
Option B is incorrect because frogs and lizards are cold-blooded, while birds are warm-blooded.

選項C錯在於蛙沒有鱗片；
Option C is incorrect because frogs have no scales.

選項D錯在於蛙的後肢具有蹼而非爪，而鳥的翅膀是前肢，也沒有爪。
Option D is incorrect because frogs have webbed hind limbs, not claws; moreover, birds do not have claws on their wings, which are their forelimbs.

📌 考試提醒：
「脊椎動物」考題常用來區分類似外形的生物，應掌握骨骼、體溫調節與生殖特徵來判別門類。
Questions about vertebrates often test structural or physiological features — focus on presence of backbone, thermoregulation, and reproduction type when identifying groups.

📘第4題
📌 參考答案： D

📖 詳細解釋：
染色體在細胞分裂前必須完成複製，以確保子細胞能各自獲得一套完整遺傳物質。
Before cell division begins, chromosomes must first replicate, ensuring that each daughter cell receives a full set of genetic material.

之後複製的染色體會在赤道面排列，再由紡錘絲拉開分離形成兩組。
The duplicated chromosomes then line up at the equator and are pulled apart along the spindle fibers.

📌 考試提醒：
複製 → 排列 → 分離是細胞分裂的核心步驟順序，是考試常見陷阱題。
Always remember the correct mitosis sequence: replicate → align → separate — often tested in tricky sequence questions.

📘第5題
📌 參考答案： C

📖 詳細解釋：
本立德試劑檢驗的是還原糖的存在，但不能區分是哪一種還原糖。
Benedict’s solution is used to detect the presence of reducing sugars, but it cannot distinguish between different types of them.

因此由顏色變化只能推斷糖類釋出於液體中，不能確定是否為葡萄糖或是否含澱粉。
Thus, any positive result only indicates diffusion of a reducing sugar, not whether the sugar is glucose or whether starch is present.

📌 考試提醒：
試劑題常考辨識錯誤：本立德液——檢驗還原糖、不檢驗澱粉或水勢。
Be careful in reagent questions: Benedict’s detects reducing sugar only, not starch or water potential.

📘第6題
📌 參考答案： D

📖 詳細解釋：
顯微鏡的影像是上下顛倒、左右相反的，因此實際影像會與標本位置鏡像對調。
The image under a microscope is inverted vertically and reversed laterally, so what appears on one side is actually on the opposite side of the specimen.

📌 考試提醒：
記得微鏡觀察方向相反的原則，移動標本向左，影像向右移。
Always recall that microscope movements are reversed — move specimen left, image shifts right.

📘第7題
📌 參考答案： A

📖 詳細解釋：
滲透速率是以曲線斜率表示，曲線在0—0.5小時最陡，因此滲透速率最大。
The rate of osmosis is indicated by the slope of the graph; the steepest slope between 0 and 0.5 hour shows the highest osmosis rate.

📌 考試提醒：
掌握「斜率＝速率」概念，可迅速判斷滲透、光合作用或酶速率題。
Remember “slope = rate” — a key technique for any graph-based questions on osmosis, photosynthesis, or enzyme activity.

📘第8題
📌 參考答案： A

📖 詳細解釋：
馬鈴薯細胞為植物細胞，具堅韌的細胞壁，當水經滲透作用進入時細胞會膨脹，形成膨壓（turgor）。
Potato cells are plant cells with rigid cell walls. When water enters through osmosis, the cells swell and become turgid.

細胞壁阻止細胞破裂，使內外水流達到平衡後停止淨流動。
The cell wall prevents bursting; once osmotic equilibrium is reached, the inflow and outflow of water become equal.

📌 考試提醒：
請區分：植物細胞可產生膨壓但不破裂；動物細胞則可能滲透破裂（溶血）。
Always differentiate: plant cells become turgid without bursting; animal cells may burst due to lysis in hypotonic conditions.

📘第9題
📌 參考答案： A

📖 詳細解釋：
DCPIP 試劑可用來測定維他命 C 的存在量，維他命 C 含量越高，所需脫色的果汁體積越少。
DCPIP is used to test for the presence of vitamin C. The higher the concentration of vitamin C, the less juice is needed to decolourize 1 cm³ of DCPIP.

在表中，P 果汁只需最少的體積即可脫色，因此它的維他命 C 濃度最高。
According to the data, juice P requires the smallest volume for decolourization, hence it contains the highest vitamin C concentration.

📌 考試提醒：
DCPIP 題常考「果汁用量少 → 維他命 C 含量高」的反比關係。
Remember the inverse relationship: the less juice needed, the higher the vitamin C content.

📘第10題
📌 參考答案： B

📖 詳細解釋：
圖中植物的葉片以互不重疊的方式排列，讓每片葉都能充分接受陽光。
The leaves are arranged so that they do not overlap, ensuring that each can receive maximum sunlight.

這樣的排列能最大化光合作用效率，是植物為增加光吸收而形成的適應。
Such arrangement maximizes photosynthetic efficiency — an adaptation for optimum light capture.

📌 考試提醒：
此考題常與光合作用速率混淆，考生應明白「葉面排列 → 吸光效率」，不是為吸雨水或防動物。
Be careful not to confuse it with other environmental functions — this pattern relates to light absorption, not rainwater collection or herbivore defense.

📘第11題
📌 參考答案： D

📖 詳細解釋：
絛蟲身體結構（構造 3）又長又扁，能增加吸收食物的表面積。
The tapeworm’s body (structure 3) is long and flat, broadening surface area for nutrient absorption.

構造 1（鉤）與構造 2（吸盤）用來固定絛蟲在宿主腸壁上；
Structures 1 (hook) and 2 (sucker) attach the worm securely to the host’s intestinal wall.

在黴菌中，構造 4（孢子囊柄）支撐孢子囊，而構造 5 為橫生菌絲，連接構造 6 吸收食物的營養菌絲。
In mould, structure 4 (sporangiophore) supports the sporangium, while 5 is the horizontal hypha connecting 6 (the absorptive hypha).

📌 考試提醒：
要熟記絛蟲與黴菌的結構—功能配對，特別是「吸盤與鉤＝附著」；「菌絲＝吸收」。
Memorize each structure–function pairing: “hooks/suckers = attachment”, “hyphae = absorption”.

📘第12題
📌 參考答案： C

📖 詳細解釋：
絛蟲的構造 1 和 2 皆用於固定於宿主小腸壁上，使其不被食物流動沖走。
Both structures 1 and 2 serve as organs of attachment, anchoring the tapeworm firmly to the host’s intestine.

📌 考試提醒：
混淆常見：吸盤與鉤皆具附著功能，但不參與吸收。真正吸收營養的是體節（構造 3）。
Common mistake: hooks and suckers attach, not absorb—nutrient uptake occurs through body segments.

📘第13題
📌 參考答案： B

📖 詳細解釋：
維他命 A 能幫助合成感光物質視紫紅質，以防止夜盲症。
Vitamin A is required for synthesizing visual purple (rhodopsin), which prevents night blindness.

在列出的食物中，肝臟含最高量的維他命 A。
Among the listed foods, liver has the richest source of vitamin A.

📌 考試提醒：
維他命 A 可從**動物肝臟或胡蘿蔔（β-胡蘿蔔素）**獲取；題目常測與視力相關疾病。
Vitamin A comes mainly from animal liver or β-carotene in carrots, often tested in eye-health questions.

📘第14題
📌 參考答案： C

📖 詳細解釋：
構造 P 是小腸絨毛內的毛細血管，它負責運送葡萄糖和氨基酸至血液中，並將氧輸送給絨毛細胞。
Structure P is a capillary within the intestinal villus. It transports glucose and amino acids absorbed by the villus into the blood and delivers oxygen to the villus cells.

它不負責運送脂肪，因為脂肪由淋巴管吸收。
It does not carry fats — fats are absorbed into the lacteal instead.

📌 考試提醒：
區分吸收路徑：脂肪→淋巴管（乳糜管）；葡萄糖與氨基酸→血毛細管。
Remember absorption routes: fats → lacteal, glucose & amino acids → blood capillary.

📘第15題
📌 參考答案： A

📖 詳細解釋：
構造 P 接受自小腸的靜脈血，將其送往肝臟，但因為它是大靜脈的一部分，所以連接的是大靜脈分支而非肝動脈。
Structure P receives venous blood from the intestine and carries it toward the liver; it is a branch of a large vein (the hepatic portal vein), not an artery.

📌 考試提醒：
「肝門靜脈」常考別於「肝靜脈」——前者輸送營養物質至肝臟，後者將血液送出肝臟。
Differentiate carefully: hepatic portal vein → brings nutrient-rich blood to liver, hepatic vein → drains blood away.

📘第16題
📌 參考答案： A

📖 詳細解釋：
構造 Q 所含液體是淋巴液（lymph），其中含有抗體與脂肪滴。
The fluid in structure Q is lymph, which contains antibodies and fat droplets.

進食後，脂肪經乳糜管進入淋巴液形成乳白色混濁外觀，而禁食時則變為透明。
After a fatty meal, tiny emulsified lipid droplets enter the lymph, giving it a milky appearance (chyle); during fasting, the lymph becomes clear.

📌 考試提醒：
淋巴液不運送葡萄糖或氧氣，兩者皆是由血毛細管吸收。
Lymph does not carry glucose or oxygen; both are absorbed via blood capillaries, not lacteals.

📘第17題
📌 參考答案： D

📖 詳細解釋：
構造 1 為肋骨，能保護肺與心臟，並與肋間肌一同協助呼吸，同時是造血骨骼。
Structure 1 represents the ribs, which protect the lungs and heart, assist breathing through intercostal movement, and also take part in blood cell formation.

📌 考試提醒：
肋骨屬「扁骨」，兼具保護及造血功能，是多重功能題常出考點。
Ribs are classified as flat bones, providing both protection and hematopoiesis — a common exam focus.

📘第18題
📌 參考答案： B

📖 詳細解釋：
呼吸過程中，肋間肌 (2) 與 橫膈膜 (5) 交替收縮與放鬆，推動胸腔容積變化以完成吸氣與呼氣。
During breathing, the intercostal muscles (2) and diaphragm (5) contract and relax rhythmically, altering thoracic volume for inspiration and expiration.

📌 考試提醒：
吸氣時：肋骨上升，橫膈下降；呼氣時：肋骨下降，橫膈上升。
In inspiration, ribs move upward and diaphragm moves downward; in expiration, the reverse occurs.

📘第19題
📌 參考答案： B

📖 詳細解釋：
吸煙中的尼古丁與焦油會破壞氣管內的纖毛組織並增加心血管疾病風險。
Nicotine and tar in cigarette smoke damage the ciliated epithelium of the trachea and increase risk of cardiovascular diseases.

酒精主要損害肝臟，過量脂肪及鹽分則導致高血壓，而非損傷氣管纖毛。
Alcohol primarily damages the liver, and excessive fat or salt causes hypertension, not ciliary damage.

📌 考試提醒：
纖毛受損 → 黏液堆積 → 咳嗽增加，是吸煙的典型生理結果。
Cilia destruction → mucus accumulation → chronic coughing — a classic physiological consequence of smoking.

📘第20題
📌 參考答案： C

📖 詳細解釋：
氯化鈣（CaCl₂）能吸收空氣及植物所釋放的水分。
Calcium chloride (CaCl₂) absorbs water both from the air and from the transpiration of the plant.

由表中資料得：
CaCl₂ 從空氣吸收的水分 = 105 − 100 = 5 g。
CaCl₂ 含植物時吸收的水分 = 120 − 100 = 20 g。
因此植物失水量 = 20 − 5 = 15 g。
From the data:
Water absorbed from air = 105 − 100 = 5 g.
Water absorbed from air + plant = 120 − 100 = 20 g.
Hence, plant water loss = 20 − 5 = 15 g.

📌 考試提醒：
植物失水＝（有植物時總增重）−（無植物時增重），題型常考差值計算法。
Plant water loss = (weight gain with plant) − (weight gain without plant). Always apply the difference method.

📘第21題
📌 參考答案： C

📖 詳細解釋：
植物的蒸騰速率在光度增強、氣流加快、氣溫提高或濕度下降時上升。
Transpiration rate increases when light intensity, air flow, or temperature rises, or when relative humidity decreases.

環境乾燥或氣流強烈會加速水分散失，而非抑制蒸騰。
Dry environments and wind enhance water loss rather than reducing it.

📌 考試提醒：
常見干擾選項為「濕度升高」與「光度減低」，兩者會降低蒸騰速率。
Beware distractors like “high humidity” or “low light” — both actually reduce transpiration rate.

📘第22題
📌 參考答案： C

📖 詳細解釋：
血球不含膽色素，因為膽色素在肝臟或脾臟分解老化紅血球時才產生，並進入膽汁中協助脂肪消化。
Blood cells do not contain bile pigments, as these are formed in the liver or spleen upon red blood cell breakdown and are excreted into bile to aid fat digestion.

脂肪由乳糜管經淋巴系統吸收，不會出現在血液中。
Fat is absorbed by lacteals into the lymphatic system, not directly into the bloodstream.

📌 考試提醒：
「血液內不含膽色素與脂肪」是經典陷阱題，務必與膽汁內容物（膽色素、膽鹽）分清。
Common trap: Blood does not contain bile pigments or fat — these are components of bile.

📘第23題
📌 參考答案： D

📖 詳細解釋：
肺靜脈輸送的是含氧血，並非二氧化碳血液。
The pulmonary vein carries oxygenated blood, not rich in carbon dioxide.

肝門靜脈的血液含高濃度葡萄糖，但非氧含量高。
The hepatic portal vein carries blood high in glucose absorbed from intestines, not high in oxygen.

因此正確答案為 D — 血液中的氧氣含量最高的是肺靜脈血。
Hence, the correct answer is D — the oxygen content is highest in pulmonary vein blood.

📌 考試提醒：
切記：「肺靜脈＝含氧血、肺動脈＝缺氧血」，常被誤記顛倒。
Remember: Pulmonary vein = oxygenated, pulmonary artery = deoxygenated — a frequent exam mix‑up.

📘第24題
📌 參考答案： B

📖 詳細解釋：
構造 1 為紅血球，主要輸送氧氣；
Structure 1 is the red blood cell, responsible for oxygen transport.

構造 2 為血小板，具凝血功能；
Structure 2 is a platelet, responsible for blood clotting.

構造 3 為白血球，能吞噬細菌以進行防禦作用。
Structure 3 is a white blood cell, which engulfs pathogens for body defense.

📌 考試提醒：
三類血球功能要熟記：「紅血球 → 運氧」、「血小板 → 凝血」、「白血球 → 防禦」。
Always remember: RBC → oxygen, platelet → clotting, WBC → defense — this triad is a staple MCQ topic.

📘 Question 25
📌 參考答案
答案：C


📌 詳細解釋
血管 Q 和 R 的瓣膜被推開，表示心臟的第 2 與第 3 腔（即左右心室）正在收縮。
The valves in vessels Q and R are forced open, showing that chambers 2 and 3 (the ventricles) are contracting.

心室收縮時產生高壓，迫使血液流出心臟並打開動脈瓣。
During ventricular contraction, pressure inside increases, pushing blood out through the arteries and forcing the semilunar valves open.

此時心房壓力較低，因此血液不會倒流進入心房。
At this moment, atrial pressure is lower, preventing blood from flowing back into the atria.

📌 考試提醒
題目測試對心臟收縮週期與瓣膜開關方向的理解。
This question assesses understanding of the cardiac cycle and valve function.

要記得：心室收縮→動脈瓣開→房室瓣關。
Remember: ventricle contracts → semilunar valves open → atrioventricular valves close.

📘 Question 26
📌 參考答案
答案：C


📌 詳細解釋
結構 3 是右心室，負責將血液經 R（肺動脈）送往肺臟。
Structure 3 is the right ventricle, which pumps blood to the lungs through vessel R (the pulmonary artery).

結構 1 是左心房，接收來自 S（肺靜脈）的含氧血液。
Structure 1 is the left atrium, which receives oxygenated blood from S (the pulmonary vein).

因此，R 和 S 均與肺循環系統有關。
Therefore, both R and S are connected to the pulmonary circulation.

📌 考試提醒
要熟記心臟血液流向：
You must memorize the correct blood flow sequence in the heart:

右心室→肺動脈→肺→肺靜脈→左心房。
Right ventricle → pulmonary artery → lungs → pulmonary vein → left atrium.

肺動脈輸送去氧血，肺靜脈輸送含氧血。
The pulmonary artery carries deoxygenated blood, while the pulmonary vein carries oxygenated blood.

📘 Question 27
📌 參考答案
答案：B


📌 詳細解釋
心臟病發的主因是心肌缺乏足夠的血液供應，使其無法獲取足夠的氧和養分進行收縮。
Heart attacks occur when cardiac muscles do not receive enough blood, thus lacking oxygen and nutrients needed for contraction.

這通常是因為冠狀動脈阻塞或狹窄，導致心肌部位缺氧壞死。
This usually results from coronary artery blockage or narrowing, causing oxygen deprivation and tissue death in the heart muscle.

缺鐵導致的是貧血，不是心臟病；乳酸積聚或一氧化碳吸入屬於其他生理異常。
Iron deficiency causes anaemia, not heart disease; lactic acid buildup or carbon monoxide poisoning are unrelated conditions.

📌 考試提醒
要理解心臟病與血液供應不足之關聯。
Understand that a heart attack is linked to inadequate blood supply to the heart muscle.

記得：冠狀動脈阻塞 → 缺氧 → 心肌細胞壞死 → 心臟病發。
Remember: blocked coronary artery → oxygen shortage → cardiac cell death → heart attack.

📘 Question 28
📌 參考答案
答案：A


📌 詳細解釋
橫切面顯示有明顯排列成圈的維管束，這是年幼莖部的典型結構特徵。
The cross-section shows vascular bundles arranged in a ring — a pattern typical of a young stem.

因為沒有發現次生生長（secondary growth）或形成層活動，所以此樣本不是木質莖。
As there is no secondary growth or visible cambium activity, the specimen is not a woody stem.

根部的維管束通常呈放射狀分佈而非環狀。
In contrast, vascular bundles in roots are arranged in a radial rather than circular pattern.

📌 考試提醒
分辨莖與根的橫切結構：
Know how to distinguish the structures of stem vs. root cross-sections:

莖：維管束呈環狀排列 (bundles in a ring)
根：維管束呈放射狀排列 (radial arrangement)

📘 Question 29
📌 參考答案
答案：B


📌 詳細解釋
結構 1 和 4 含有薄壁組織，這些細胞透過膨壓支撐植物柔軟的部分。
Structures 1 and 4 consist of parenchyma cells, which provide mechanical support by maintaining cell turgidity.

薄壁細胞壁薄，能儲存水和養分，並有助於光合作用的產物運輸。
They have thin primary walls, store water and nutrients, and help in the transport of photosynthetic products.

結構 3（木質部）透過細胞壁內的木質素提供硬性支撐，而結構 2（韌皮部）不具支撐功能。
Structure 3 (xylem) gives rigid support via lignified walls, whereas structure 2 (phloem) does not provide support.

📌 考試提醒
要能區分植物支持類型：
Be able to identify different types of plant support:

膨壓支撐：薄壁細胞（parenchyma）
機械支撐：厚角與厚壁組織（collenchyma & sclerenchyma）
木質化支撐：木質部（xylem）

📘 Question 30
📌 參考答案
答案：B


📌 詳細解釋
結構 2 是韌皮部 (phloem)，主要負責運輸由葉製造的有機養分，例如蔗糖及氨基酸。
Structure 2 is the phloem, which transports organic nutrients produced in leaves — mainly sucrose and amino acids.

韌皮部可進行雙向輸送，根據植物的生理需要，物質可以向上或向下移動。
The phloem allows bidirectional transport; materials can move up or down depending on the plant’s physiological demands.

而結構 3（木質部）則只運送水分和無機鹽，方向單一由根→葉。
In contrast, structure 3 (xylem) transports water and minerals unidirectionally from roots to leaves.

📌 考試提醒
分清木質部與韌皮部功能：
Always distinguish between xylem and phloem functions clearly.

木質部 Xylem → 水與礦物 (Water & minerals)
韌皮部 Phloem → 有機養分 (Organic nutrients like sugars)

📘 Question 31
📌 參考答案
B

📌 詳細解釋
結構 1（頭骨）、2（脊柱）及 4（肋骨）屬於中軸骨骼，用以支撐與保護中樞器官。
Structures 1 (skull), 2 (vertebral column), and 4 (ribs) belong to the axial skeleton, which supports and protects the central organs.

頭骨保護腦部，脊柱包圍脊髓，而肋骨形成胸腔保護心臟與肺。
The skull protects the brain, the vertebral column encloses the spinal cord, and the ribs form the rib cage to protect the heart and lungs.

結構 3（骨盆帶）則屬於附肢骨骼，連接並支撐後肢。
Structure 3 (pelvic girdle) belongs to the appendicular skeleton, connecting and supporting the hind limbs.

📌 考試提醒
記住中軸骨骼與附肢骨骼的範圍。
Remember the parts of the axial and appendicular skeletons.

中軸骨骼包括頭骨、脊柱、肋骨及胸骨，負責支撐軀幹與保護主要器官。
The axial skeleton includes the skull, vertebral column, ribs, and sternum, which support the trunk and protect vital organs.

附肢骨骼包括四肢及其帶骨（肩帶與骨盆帶），主要負責運動。
The appendicular skeleton includes the limbs and the girdles (pectoral and pelvic) that facilitate movement.

📘 Question 32
📌 參考答案
C

📌 詳細解釋
頭骨包裹和保護大腦，維持腦組織免受衝擊。
The skull encloses and protects the brain from mechanical injury.

脊柱圍繞脊髓，防止神經線受壓或損壞。
The vertebral column surrounds the spinal cord, shielding it from compression and damage.

肋骨形成胸廓以保護心臟與肺，為內臟提供機械支撐。
The ribs form the thoracic cage to protect the heart and lungs and provide mechanical support for breathing.

📌 考試提醒
要熟悉各骨骼結構所保護的器官。
Know which organs are protected by each skeletal structure.

頭骨 → 腦；脊柱 → 脊髓；肋骨 → 心臟與肺臟。
Skull → brain; vertebral column → spinal cord; ribs → heart and lungs.

這些結構均屬中軸骨骼，考試時常以器官保護功能考核。
These are all components of the axial skeleton, frequently tested for their protective function.

📘 Question 33
📌 參考答案
D

📌 詳細解釋
E 是支點，F 是施力點，而 W 是負荷。
E is the pivot, F represents the point of effort, and W is the load.

當支點與施力的距離短於支點與負荷的距離時，只需少量肌肉收縮即可產生較大位移。
When the distance between pivot and effort is shorter than that between pivot and load, a small muscle contraction can move the load a longer distance.

這是第三類槓桿的特徵，用於需要靈活快速運動的部位，如人類手臂。
This is the feature of a third-class lever, commonly found in body parts requiring speed and flexibility, such as the human forearm.

📌 考試提醒
記住三類槓桿的力及距離關係。
Remember the force and distance relationship of the three classes of levers.

第一類槓桿：支點在中間，例如頸部抬頭。
First-class lever: pivot in the middle (e.g., neck when lifting the head).

第二類槓桿：負荷在中間，例如小腿抬起腳跟。
Second-class lever: load in the middle (e.g., raising the heel).

第三類槓桿：施力在中間，例如前臂屈肘。
Third-class lever: effort in the middle (e.g., bending the forearm).

📘 Question 34
📌 參考答案
D

📌 詳細解釋
結構 3（輸尿管）含最高的尿素濃度，因它運送尿液至膀胱作排泄。
Structure 3 (ureter) contains the highest concentration of urea as it carries urine to the bladder for excretion.

結構 2（腎動脈）輸入含高尿素的血液至腎臟進行過濾。
Structure 2 (renal artery) carries blood with a high level of urea into the kidney for filtration.

結構 1（腎靜脈）帶走被過濾後的血液，因此尿素濃度最低。
Structure 1 (renal vein) carries filtered blood away from the kidney, therefore having the lowest urea concentration.

濃度順序為：3 > 2 > 1。
Hence, the order of urea concentration is 3 > 2 > 1.

📌 考試提醒
考題測試對腎臟過濾與排泄過程的理解。
This question tests understanding of kidney filtration and excretion process.

記住：血液經腎臟過濾後尿素濃度下降，而尿液中的濃度最高。
Remember: after blood passes through the kidney, urea concentration decreases in the blood but is highest in the urine.

由腎動脈進入 → 腎臟過濾 → 經腎靜脈流出 → 尿液由輸尿管送至膀胱。
Flow sequence: renal artery → kidney filtration → renal vein → urine via ureter to bladder.

📘 Question 35
📌 參考答案
D

📌 詳細解釋
構造 2（壺腹）和構造 4（耳蝸）中含有感覺毛細胞，分別接收運動和平衡以及聲音的刺激。
Structures 2 (ampulla) and 4 (cochlea) contain sensory hair cells that detect motion and balance, and sound respectively.

壺腹位於半規管的一端，能偵測角加速度與頭部轉動方向。
The ampulla, located at the end of the semicircular canals, detects angular acceleration and rotational movement of the head.

耳蝸內的柯蒂氏器含有震動接收的毛細胞，可感應不同頻率的聲波轉為神經衝動。
The cochlea contains the organ of Corti, where hair cells convert sound vibrations into nerve impulses.

📌 考試提醒
要分清楚耳朵各部分感受不同的刺激。
Be sure to distinguish which ear structures detect which types of stimuli.

壺腹與半規管 → 平衡與運動，耳蝸 → 聽覺。
Ampulla and semicircular canals → balance and motion; cochlea → hearing.

外耳與中耳沒有感覺細胞，只負責傳遞聲波。
The outer and middle ears contain no sensory receptors; they only transmit sound.

📘 Question 36
📌 參考答案
D

📌 詳細解釋
外耳和中耳內部均充滿空氣，包括構造 7（外耳道）與 6（中耳）。
The outer and middle ear are air-filled, including structures 7 (external auditory canal) and 6 (middle ear).

相反地，內耳（如耳蝸和半規管）內部充滿內淋巴液和外淋巴液，用以傳遞機械振動。
In contrast, the inner ear — including the cochlea and semicircular canals — is filled with endolymph and perilymph, which transmit mechanical vibrations to sensory cells.

這樣的流體環境有助於平衡與聲波感應。
This fluid environment is essential for balance detection and hearing.

📌 考試提醒
切勿混淆不同耳部腔體所含介質。
Avoid confusing the mediums contained in different ear regions.

外耳與中耳 → 空氣；內耳 → 液體。
Outer and middle ears → air; inner ear → fluid.

外耳負責收集聲音，中耳放大聲波，內耳進行感受與轉換。
Outer ear captures sound, middle ear amplifies it, and inner ear detects and converts it into nerve impulses.

📘 Question 37
📌 參考答案
B

📌 詳細解釋
胰島素並非酵素，而是由胰臟分泌的荷爾蒙。
Insulin is not an enzyme but a hormone secreted by the pancreas.

它不會參與催化反應，而是刺激肝臟把葡萄糖轉為糖原，以調節血糖濃度。
It does not catalyze reactions, but stimulates the liver to convert glucose into glycogen, helping to regulate blood glucose levels.

胰島素經由血液進入體循環，而不是透過腺體導管排出。
Insulin enters the bloodstream directly and not through any duct.

大腦並不直接控制血糖濃度，而是由內分泌系統的負回饋調節。
The brain does not directly control blood glucose; regulation occurs through endocrine negative feedback mechanisms.

📌 考試提醒
分清楚「酵素」與「荷爾蒙」的差異。
Be clear on the distinction between enzymes and hormones.

酵素進行化學催化反應；荷爾蒙則調節生理過程。
Enzymes catalyze biochemical reactions, while hormones regulate physiological processes.

胰島素由胰臟的朗氏島分泌，功能是降低血糖，而非促進反應速率。
Insulin is secreted by the islets of Langerhans in the pancreas and functions to lower blood glucose, not to speed up reactions.

📘 Question 38
📌 參考答案
C（題刪）

📌 詳細解釋
由表中可見，近點距離隨年齡增加而增大，表示老年人需要把書報拿得更遠才可看清。
As shown in the table, the near point increases with age, meaning older individuals must hold reading material further away to see clearly.

這是由於水晶體的彈性下降，讓睫狀肌難以使晶體變厚來聚焦近物。
This occurs because the lens of the eye becomes less elastic, making it harder for the ciliary muscles to thicken the lens for near focusing.

因此他們會出現老花現象，而非短視（近視）減輕。
Hence, presbyopia develops, not a reduction in short-sightedness.

📌 考試提醒
題目考查調節作用（accommodation）與老花眼（presbyopia）。
The question tests understanding of accommodation and presbyopia.

隨年齡增長，水晶體硬化、彈性降低，導致近點距離增加。
With age, the lens stiffens and loses elasticity, increasing near point distance.

近視與老花是不同類型的視覺問題。
Short-sightedness and presbyopia are distinct visual conditions.

📘 Question 39
📌 參考答案
C

📌 詳細解釋
當蜜蜂飛近男孩的臉時，他的眼睛晶狀體需增加曲率以聚焦近距離物體。
When the bee approaches the boy’s face, his lens becomes more curved to focus on the nearby object.

這是因為睫狀肌收縮，使懸韌帶鬆弛，晶狀體恢復更厚的形狀。
This happens as the ciliary muscles contract, loosening the suspensory ligaments so the lens thickens.

當蜜蜂停在他鼻尖上時，物距保持極近，晶狀體曲率維持不變。
When the bee lands on his nose, the object distance stays minimal, so the curvature remains constant.

📌 考試提醒
理解調節作用機制：
Understand how accommodation works.

看近物 → 睫狀肌收縮，晶狀體變厚。
For near objects → ciliary muscles contract, lens thickens.

看遠物 → 睫狀肌放鬆，晶狀體變薄。
For distant objects → ciliary muscles relax, lens flattens.

這過程是由副交感神經控制，與焦距調節密切相關。
This process is controlled by the parasympathetic nervous system and directly affects focus adjustment.

📘 Question 40
📌 參考答案
A

📌 詳細解釋
由曲線可見，當生長素濃度為 10⁻³ ppm 時，根與莖的生長均受到刺激。
From the graph, both root and shoot growth are stimulated when the auxin concentration is 10⁻³ ppm.

根與莖對生長素的敏感度不同，根在低濃度時促進生長，而高濃度時則被抑制。
Roots and shoots have different sensitivities to auxin; low concentrations promote root growth, while higher concentrations inhibit it.

這合理反映了植物生長素在不同濃度下的「雙重作用」特性。
This illustrates the “dual effect” of auxin: it can either promote or inhibit growth depending on its concentration.

📌 考試提醒
要掌握生長素濃度與植物器官反應的關係。
Understand the relationship between auxin concentration and organ response.

低濃度：促進根生長
高濃度：促進莖生長或抑制根伸展
過高濃度：根、莖皆被抑制
Auxin affects growth differently in roots and shoots at the same concentration due to tissue sensitivity differences.

📘 Question 41
📌 參考答案
A

📌 詳細解釋
高濃度的生長素會更明顯地抑制莖的生長。
A higher concentration of auxin more strongly inhibits shoot growth.

因此，當右側受到較高生長素濃度時，左側細胞生長較快，使莖彎向左方。
Thus, as the right side of the shoot has more auxin and thus slower growth, the left side elongates faster, causing the shoot to bend leftward.

這是生長素分佈不均導致的「向光性」表現。
This demonstrates phototropism, where uneven distribution of auxin causes bending towards light.

📌 考試提醒
生長素能使背光面細胞生長加快，使莖向光彎曲。
Auxin causes faster elongation on the shaded side, bending the shoot toward light.

記得區分根與莖的反應方向：根對高濃度敏感且被抑制，莖則促進伸長。
Remember: roots are inhibited by high auxin concentrations, while shoots are promoted at moderate levels.

📘 Question 42
📌 參考答案
D

📌 詳細解釋
種子形成涉及雄、雌配子的受精作用，是有性生殖。
Seed formation involves the fertilization between male and female gametes, a form of sexual reproduction.

二分裂與孢子形成均不需受精，屬於無性生殖。
Binary fission and spore formation occur without fertilization and are forms of asexual reproduction.

塊莖的形成則屬於營養繁殖，也是無性生殖的一種。
The formation of tubers is vegetative propagation, another method of asexual reproduction.

📌 考試提醒
要理解「受精作用」是有性生殖的關鍵步驟。
Recognize that fertilization is the defining step of sexual reproduction.

不涉及受精的生殖方式，如分裂、出芽、孢子形成及營養繁殖，均屬無性生殖。
Any reproductive process without fertilization — such as fission, budding, spore formation, or vegetative propagation — is asexual.

📘 Question 43
📌 參考答案
A

📌 詳細解釋
光線在三種條件下都存在，對種子萌發沒有明顯影響。
Light is present in all three test conditions and shows no significant effect on germination.

在盤 2 中，缺乏水與溫度，即使有光也無法使種子萌發。
In pot 2, both water and warmth are absent, so seeds cannot germinate despite the presence of light.

在盤 3 中，雖有溫度但缺水，種子仍未萌發。
In pot 3, warmth is present but water is missing, so no germination occurs.

因此，只有水分被證實是萌發的必要條件。
Hence, only water is essential for germination to begin.

📌 考試提醒
記住種子萌發的三大基本條件：
Always remember the three essential factors for seed germination:

水分（Water）→ 使胚吸水並啟動代謝
溫度（Warmth）→ 促進酵素活性
氧氣（Oxygen）→ 供應呼吸能量
光有時影響萌發，但非普遍所需條件。
Light may affect some seeds but is not universally required.

📘 Question 44
📌 參考答案
A

📌 詳細解釋
由於溫度、光與水分皆不影響此盤的萌發，唯一合理的原因是種子已失去活性。
As warmth, light, and water had no effect on the sample’s germination, the only logical explanation is that the seeds are dead.

死種子無法進行呼吸或代謝，胚也無法發芽。
Dead seeds cannot respire or metabolize; thus, the embryo cannot develop.

📌 考試提醒
考試常測試對「無法萌發」原因的判斷。
This type of question tests your ability to reason why germination fails.

如果所有條件均具備卻仍無萌發，應推斷種子不具活性。
If all environmental conditions are met but germination fails, infer lack of viability.

死種子或受損胚是最常見原因。
Dead or damaged embryos are the most common causes.

📘第 45 題
📌 參考答案：A

📌 詳細解釋：
營養繁殖使子植物能迅速生長，因為新植株可直接依賴母株儲存的營養物質。
Vegetative propagation allows the daughter plant to grow quickly because it can utilize the stored nutrients of the parent plant.

這種方式屬於無性生殖，雖能維持優良品種，但缺乏遺傳變化，難以適應環境變化。
This process is a form of asexual reproduction; while it preserves desirable traits, it lacks genetic variation and thus limits adaptability to environmental changes.

此外，母株的病菌或病毒亦可能傳遞至新植株。
Moreover, any diseases present in the parent may be transmitted to the offspring.

📌 考試提醒：
凡提到「無性生殖」、「營養繁殖」或「無遺傳變化」，應強調其繁殖速度快但多樣性低。
When questions mention “asexual reproduction” or “vegetative propagation,” always stress rapid growth but low genetic diversity.

📘第 46 題
📌 參考答案：B

📌 詳細解釋：
卵巢（構造 2）和花藥（構造 4）分別含有胚珠與花粉，兩者均可找到單倍體細胞。
The ovary (structure 2) and anther (structure 4) contain ovules and pollen respectively, both containing haploid cells.

胚珠內有雌配子（卵細胞），而花粉內含雄配子。
The ovule holds the female gamete (egg cell), while pollen carries the male gamete.

這些單倍體配子是受精的必要條件，用於形成二倍體合子。
These haploid gametes are essential for fertilization and combine to form a diploid zygote.

📌 考試提醒：
留意「單倍體」一詞只出現在生殖細胞內，不會在花瓣、花萼等體細胞結構中出現。
Remember that “haploid” cells are found only in reproductive tissues, not in structures such as petals or sepals.

📘第 47 題
📌 參考答案：D

📌 詳細解釋：
柱頭（構造 5）負責接收花粉，是授粉過程的第一步。
The stigma (structure 5) serves as the receptive surface for pollen grains, marking the first step of pollination.

花粉落在柱頭黏液上後會萌芽，長出花粉管穿過花柱到達子房。
After landing on the sticky stigma, pollen grains germinate and produce pollen tubes that grow through the style to reach the ovary.

這確保雄核能順利進入胚珠與卵細胞結合。
This pathway ensures that the male nuclei successfully reach and fuse with the egg cell inside the ovule.

📌 考試提醒：
題目若提到「接收花粉」「授粉表面」等字眼，關鍵答案一定是柱頭 (stigma)。
When cues like “receiving pollen” or “pollination surface” appear, the correct structure is always the stigma.

📘第 48 題
📌 參考答案：C

📌 詳細解釋：
嬰兒出生後，胎盤（構造 1）、臍帶（構造 2）及羊膜（構造 3）會一起排出母體，統稱為胎衣。
After birth, the placenta (structure 1), umbilical cord (structure 2), and amnion (structure 3) are expelled as the afterbirth.

但構造 4 為子宮肌肉，屬於母體的一部分，並不會被排出。
However, structure 4 represents the uterine muscle, which remains in the body and is not expelled.

📌 考試提醒：
要區分「胎衣」與「母體組織」；凡屬胚胎來源的結構（如胎盤、羊膜）才會被排出。
Differentiate between fetal membranes (expelled) and maternal tissues (retained)—only embryonic layers form the afterbirth.

📘第 49 題
📌 參考答案：A

📌 詳細解釋：
胎盤（構造 1）與臍帶（構造 2）內含血管，可將胎兒產生的代謝廢物輸送至母體。
The placenta (structure 1) and umbilical cord (structure 2) contain blood vessels that transport metabolic waste from the fetus to the mother.

同時，氧氣與養分也透過胎盤進入胎兒，以維持其生長及代謝。
Meanwhile, oxygen and nutrients pass from the mother to the fetus through the placenta to support growth and metabolism.

📌 考試提醒：
胎盤與臍帶常成對出現，功能一為物質交換、一為運輸廢物與營養。
The placenta and umbilical cord are often paired—their roles are exchange and transport of substances between fetus and mother.

📘第 50 題
📌 參考答案：A

📌 詳細解釋：
抗生素是由微生物製造的化學物質，可抑制或殺死其他微生物。
Antibiotics are chemical substances produced by microorganisms that can inhibit or kill other microbes.

它們並不通過與抗原結合發揮作用，而是干擾細胞壁合成或蛋白質製造等重要過程。
They do not function by binding to antigens but rather by disrupting vital processes such as cell wall or protein synthesis.

📌 考試提醒：
須區分抗生素（抗菌化學物）與抗體（免疫蛋白）——前者由微生物產生，後者由淋巴細胞製造。
Be careful not to confuse antibiotics (chemical agents) with antibodies (immune proteins)—the former are made by microbes, the latter by lymphocytes.

📘第51題
📌 參考答案： B

📖 詳細解釋：
該雜交結果約為 50% 高莖與 50% 矮莖。由此可推知，母本為 tt （矮莖），父本若為 TT 則所有後代表現為 Tt （皆為高莖），只有父本為 Tt 時，交配 Tt × tt 才會產生 1 : 1 的表現比例。
The cross gives approximately 50% tall and 50% short plants. This implies that the short parent is tt, and the only genotype for the tall parent that can yield a 1 : 1 ratio (T : t) is Tt, since a TT × tt cross would produce all tall (Tt) offspring.

📌 考試提醒：
若結果為 1 : 1 比例，表示「雙親之一為純合隱性，另一為雜合」。
A 1 : 1 ratio between phenotypes confirms that one parent is homozygous recessive and the other is heterozygous.

📘第52題
📌 參考答案： A

📖 詳細解釋：
實驗與孟德爾定律的預測略有差距，是因為受精是隨機的且樣本數不足。小樣本會導致機率偏差，因此實際比例可能與理論值略不同，但在樣本數增大時結果會接近預測值。
The deviation from Mendel’s expected ratio arises because fertilization is a random event and the sample size is relatively small. With limited offspring, the observed ratio may deviate from probability predictions; however, as the sample size increases, results tend to approximate the theoretical ratio.

📌 考試提醒：
記得強調：孟德爾定律表達的是機率關係，並非每次雜交都會完全符合。
Always note that Mendelian ratios represent probabilities, not exact outcomes for every cross.

📘第53題
📌 參考答案： A

📖 詳細解釋：
只有減數分裂可使親代細胞產生具有不同基因型的配子。精子由減數分裂產生；而神經元無法分裂，肌肉細胞與白血球則由有絲分裂產生，基因型與親代相同。
Only meiosis produces daughter cells with genetic variation. Sperms are formed by meiosis, whereas neurons cannot divide, and muscle cells or white blood cells are produced by mitosis, retaining identical genetic make‑up to the parent cell.

📌 考試提醒：
考題關鍵字為「不同基因型」，即指減數分裂；若題目提「完全相同」，則為有絲分裂。
Keyword clue: “Different genotype” = meiosis; “identical cells” = mitosis.

📘第54題
📌 參考答案： C

📖 詳細解釋：
二氧化硫（SO₂）為酸性氣體，遇水形成硫酸導致酸雨，腐蝕石灰岩建築並損害樹木。碳微粒與 CO₂ 不具酸性，不會造成化學腐蝕，而臭氧則主要影響呼吸道，不致引起酸蝕。
Sulphur dioxide (SO₂) is an acidic gas that produces sulphuric acid when dissolved in water, leading to acid rain that corrodes limestone buildings and harms forests. Carbon dust and CO₂ lack acidity, and ozone mainly irritates the respiratory system rather than corroding stones.

📌 考試提醒：
辨識酸雨成因時，首要掌握「SO₂ → H₂SO₄」，其次可提及「NOₓ → HNO₃」。
For acid rain questions, remember the key conversions: “SO₂ → H₂SO₄” and optionally “NOₓ → HNO₃.”

📘第55題
📌 參考答案： B

📖 詳細解釋：
固氮菌將大氣中的氮轉為硝酸鹽，提供豆科植物營養；植物則提供有機物予細菌，雙方互利共生。其他選項如捕食、寄生、競爭皆非雙方受益。
Nitrogen‑fixing bacteria convert atmospheric nitrogen into nitrates for leguminous plants, while receiving organic nutrients from them — a classic case of mutualism. In contrast, predation, parasitism, and competition benefit only one side or harm both.

📌 考試提醒：
判斷關鍵：若「雙方皆從關係中得益」→ 互利共生；若「一方得益、一方受害」→ 寄生或捕食；若「雙方皆受損」→ 競爭。
Key tip: “Both benefit” → mutualism; “one benefits, other harmed” → parasitism/predation; “both harmed” → competition.

📘第 56 題
📌 參考答案：A

📌 詳細解釋：
在植物的新陳代謝過程中，僅有呼吸作用會導致能量的散失。
In plant metabolism, only respiration results in energy loss.

呼吸作用會分解有機物以釋放能量，供植物生長與維持生命活動使用。
Respiration breaks down organic compounds to release energy for growth and essential functions.

相反，光合作用是吸收太陽能以合成有機物的過程，並非能量流失的來源。
Conversely, photosynthesis captures solar energy to produce organic materials, not as a form of energy loss.

蒸騰作用雖需能量來蒸發水分，但該能量來自外界環境，而非植物所儲存的能量。
Though transpiration involves energy for evaporation, it uses heat from the surroundings rather than from the plant’s own energy store.

📌 考試提醒：
要能區分「能量輸入」與「能量流失」的方向，只有呼吸作用屬於能量釋放過程。
Understand clearly the direction of energy flow — only respiration releases energy from organic molecules.

📘第 57 題
📌 參考答案：D

📌 詳細解釋：
草蜢與螳螂的綠色體色使牠們能與草叢融為一體，減少被捕食者發現的機會。
The green coloration of grasshoppers and mantises helps them blend into the grass, reducing the chance of being spotted by predators.

這是一種保護色（偽裝），幫助牠們提高生存率。
This is an example of protective coloration (camouflage) that increases their chance of survival.

不同於警戒色（如黃黑相間）用於警告敵人，保護色主要用於隱藏自身。
Unlike warning coloration (e.g., yellow and black stripes), camouflage functions to conceal the organism from threats.

📌 考試提醒：
題目若出現「顏色與環境相似」、「避免被獵食」等字眼時，正確答案通常是保護色（camouflage）。
When keywords like “blend with environment” or “avoid predators” appear, the correct concept is usually camouflage.

📘第 58 題
📌 參考答案：D

📌 詳細解釋：
冷藏法的低溫不會殺死微生物，僅令牠們進入不活躍或休眠狀態。
Refrigeration temperatures do not kill microorganisms; they only slow down or suspend their activity.

因此，微生物雖不繁殖，但仍能在恢復常溫時重新生長。
Hence, microbes remain viable and can resume growth when the temperature returns to normal.

相比之下，煮沸或巴斯德消毒法能以高溫破壞細菌蛋白質並殺死微生物。
In contrast, boiling and pasteurization employ high temperatures that denature proteins and kill microbes.

📌 考試提醒：
要區分「抑制微生物生長」與「殺死微生物」的差別——冷凍冷藏屬前者，高溫滅菌屬後者。
Be able to distinguish between inhibiting microbial growth (refrigeration/freezing) and killing microbes (heat sterilization).

📘第 59 題
📌 參考答案：C

📌 詳細解釋：
青黴素和許多其他抗生素的效力逐漸降低，是因為細菌能在短時間內產生抗藥性。
Penicillin and many other antibiotics have become less effective because bacteria can rapidly develop drug resistance.

細菌在分裂繁殖時突變率高，若突變有助於抵抗抗生素，該菌株便能存活並繁衍。
Bacteria have a high mutation rate during cell division, and any mutation offering resistance allows those bacteria to survive and multiply.

這種自然選擇的過程最終導致具有抗藥性的菌種增多，使抗生素功效下降。
This process of natural selection leads to an increasing number of resistant strains, reducing the overall effectiveness of antibiotics.

📌 考試提醒：
當題目提及「抗藥性產生原因」時，應聯想到突變（mutation）與自然選擇（natural selection）。
When asked about the cause of antibiotic resistance, always refer to mutation and natural selection as key mechanisms.

📘第 60 題
📌 參考答案：A

📌 詳細解釋：
正常人有 23 對染色體，而圖中第 21 對出現多出一條，即為異常現象。
A normal human has 23 pairs of chromosomes, but in the diagram, there is an extra chromosome in the 21st pair, which is abnormal.

這種情況稱為 21 號染色體三體症（唐氏綜合症）。
This condition is known as trisomy 21, or Down syndrome.

Y 染色體的缺失僅出現在女性，因此與此情況無關；不同對的染色體長短不同屬正常現象。
Absence of a Y chromosome occurs only in females; differences in chromosome length and shape between pairs are normal.

📌 考試提醒：
題目出現「第 21 對」或「多出一條染色體」時，要立即識別為 唐氏綜合症（Down syndrome）。
When you see "extra chromosome in pair 21," always identify the disorder as Down syndrome (Trisomy 21).
